revised_title: Experimental Determination of Volume-Extensibility of Ethyl Alcohol
tldr: The authors conducted an experiment to determine the volume-extensibility of ethyl alcohol by measuring the tensile stress and strain. They used a combination of the method of cooling and a new method to measure stress, allowing them to measure stress and strain for ethyl alcohol up to a tension of over 17 atmospheres. The results showed that stress and absolute strain were proportional, and the absolute coefficient of elasticity was constant within the limits of observational error.
